### *The Orthodox Methods of the Upper Clarity Heavenly Pivot Institute’s Returning Chariot and Concluding Dao, Volume One*

#### **Seal of the Nine Elders of the Upper Clarity Immortal Capital**
The Seal of the Nine Elders of the Upper Clarity Immortal Capital, when worn into the mountains, subdues wolves, tigers, and spectral beings; when crossing rivers, winds and rains align to aid passage. It commands all grotto-heavens and immortal officials. If one bears this seal, weapons cannot harm, tigers cannot wound, waters cannot drown; in times of great peril, deliverance is assured. For ordinary folk, it prolongs life, suppresses malevolent spirits, and repels all evil. To treat night terrors in children, fright-wind, and all manner of ailments in adults, burn the seal to ash and administer it with frankincense decoction—efficacy is immediate. It hastens childbirth and expels stillborn fetuses; when worn, it stabilizes pregnancy. For women without children, it brings conception. It resolves curses, redresses grievances, sharpens the mind, and fulfills all uses.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of eight characters in two lines of stacked seal script.

---

#### **Seal of Governance and Universal Command**
The Seal of Governance and Universal Command serves as a military seal. Its bearer commands all spirits, immortals, officials, territorial deities, city gods, earth temples, and spectral soldiers across the Three Realms, regardless of rank. Worn, it carries the authority of the Celestial Emperor; all ferocious spirits submit. Without this seal, those practicing methods cannot deploy spectral troops. When the seal moves, the troops advance; when it halts, they stop. To move the seal is to move the army. If troops disobey, all—regardless of rank—are executed, as spectral enforcers ensure justice. After execution, a memorial may be submitted to the Celestial Emperor.

Thus, troops follow the seal’s turn, generals obey its commands; violations of orders incur severe penalties.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of six characters in two lines of stacked seal script.

---

#### **Seal of the Great Heavenly Thunderfire**
The Seal of the Great Heavenly Thunderfire governs all mountains, rivers, forests, temples, altars, dragons, and *shen* across the world; when the seal stirs, thunder responds. This seal must not be used alongside others. To summon sweet rains, inscribe an iron plaque at a dragon’s abode, seal it with paper, and impress it with this seal. Have someone cast it into water, and the dragon spirit will rise at once. If waters harbor monsters, forests spawn demons, or ancient temples invite disaster, draft a document, affix the seal, and impress it—waterborne creatures will perish, temples collapse, forests wither, or be consumed by celestial fire and lightning.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of six characters in two lines of stacked celestial seal script.

---

#### **Seal of the Intendant of City Gods**
The Seal of the Intendant of City Gods confers the office of Intendant of City Gods, acting on Heaven’s behalf. Those appointed must possess this seal; without it, they cannot traverse the world. Wherever the city god travels, yin officials report, and spectral escorts attend. Assigned assistant soldiers and clerics accompany them through mountains, forests, temples, and across rivers or seas. Day and night, subordinate troops remain at their side. All petitions to city gods require this seal for immediate response. If city god troops fail to arrive or disobey, a memorial may be submitted to the Celestial Emperor to demote or relocate them according to law.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of six characters in two lines of stacked celestial seal script.

---

#### **Seal of the Upper Clarity Heavenly Pivot Institute**
The Seal of the Upper Clarity Heavenly Pivot Institute serves as the bureau for memorials to the Three Heavenly Gates of Upper Clarity. For mortals practicing methods, submitting memorials to celestial courts, or issuing directives to spirits of the middle and lower realms, this seal is essential. Excluding the Celestial Emperor, memorials may be submitted to all—from the Five Peaks and famous mountains of the middle realm to the gods of Fengdu in the lower realm, regardless of rank. Worn, it dispels evil; ingested, it cures illness. Wherever it travels, all spirits submit, and spectral attendants accompany its bearer.

The seal measures one *cun* and eight *fen* in width, one *cun* and nine *fen* in length. Its inscription consists of six characters in two lines of stacked seal script.

---

#### **Seal of the Great Master of Heavenly Methods**
The Seal of the Great Master of Heavenly Methods commands all spectral beings and the Six Grotto Demon Kings. Wherever malevolent spirits wreak havoc, dragons or *shen* stir calamity, or harm befalls the people, all talismans and registers require this seal. For those wronged by curses, ancestral spirits, or karmic debts of life or wealth, wearing this seal keeps vengeful spirits at bay and wards off evil karma. It dispels nightmares, harmonizes all affairs, cures chronic ailments, prolongs life, prevents poisoning, and averts the Nine Worms.

Ingested regularly, it eradicates long-standing illnesses.

To expel stillborn fetuses or hasten childbirth, burn the seal to ash and ingest it.

The seal measures one *cun* and eight *fen* in width, one *cun* and nine *fen* in length, its inscription consisting of six characters in two lines of stacked seal script.

**Vermilion Luminous Divine Talisman of Supreme Purity**
*Scattered Form* | *Gathered Form*

The Vermilion Luminous Divine Talisman of Supreme Purity is the true *qi* of the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper, naturally assuming form. Issued by the Celestial Pivot Bureau of Supreme Purity, it may shatter demonic shrines, expel evil, enter plague-ridden zones, and repel epidemics.

Worn constantly, it shields the body, rendering all malevolence powerless to assail; spirits behold it as a towering mountain of fire.

Regular ingestion sharpens the mind, prevents malignant ailments, neutralizes poisons, and grants fearlessness before blades.

It cures all manner of grave illnesses and alleviates pain. It treats madness, night terrors in children, convulsions, and febrile seizures; ensures safe pregnancies, hastens labor, expels stillborn fetuses, dispels ghostly *qi* and spectral pregnancies, eliminates the Three Corpses, and severs demonic unions. Steeped in decoctions, its efficacy is unfailing.

To inscribe this talisman, form the mudra with the left hand by pressing the *wu* finger upward while reciting the incantation:

*Incantation:*

The Seven Perfected of the Northern Dipper, great deities of the celestial center.
Above, they ascend to the Golden Gates; below, they overspread Kunlun.
They regulate the cosmic net and govern the framework of Heaven and Earth.
Greedy Wolf, Giant Gate, Wealth Storage, Literary Star,
Integrity and Chastity, Martial Star, Breaking Army, and the Auxiliary Star.
They encompass the great celestial realm, penetrating even the tiniest speck of dust.
What disaster do they not eradicate? What blessing do they not bestow?
The primordial imperial *qi* comes to merge with my body.
Wherever the Celestial Pivot points, it revolves day and night without cease.
Those who dwell apart from petty men, who seek the Dao and pursue the Perfected,
shall constantly behold the august countenance and be granted longevity.
The Most High Jade Emperor, the Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord.
The Three Terraces gave me birth, the Three Terraces nurtured me,
the Three Terraces protected me, □□□□□□□.

*Incantation:*
Qian, the Creative, is strong and unswerving.
Sun and moon are my soldiers.
The divine talisman enters the five viscera,
forever preserving peace and tranquility.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

**The Divine Talisman of the Nine Prisons of Highest Clarity**
The Divine Talisman of the Nine Prisons of Highest Clarity is employed to remedy spectral and demonic harms afflicting the human realm, where malevolent toxins and inauspicious omens arise.
It governs doors opening and closing, wells and springs surging and boiling, household pots and cauldrons emitting eerie sounds, insects and rodents behaving strangely, and all manner of apparitions manifesting in forms and shadows, driving people to madness, inflicting chronic illness, and confining them to bed, where remedies prove ineffective.
Beneath the dwelling, foul and putrid ghosts and defiling spirits persist unceasingly.
Present a written petition to this court for endorsement.
Inscribe the talisman on an iron plate with raw cinnabar, following the prescribed method, and bury it beneath the dwelling’s ground.
To establish the Fengdu Prisons, use a piece of yellow silk, one foot and two inches in length and seven inches in width, inscribe the talisman upon it, and affix it within the prison.
If water spirits cause mischief, cast the talisman into the water.
For iron plates, larger ones measure two feet and four inches in length and one foot and two inches in width; smaller ones measure one foot and two inches in length and seven inches in width. Inscribe them accordingly.
This talisman must be drawn on a *wu* day; it may not be drawn on other days.
While inscribing, stand in a *ding*-shaped stance, ensuring no one witnesses the process.
Form the mudra with the left hand by pressing the thumb against the middle joint of the middle finger, recite the incantation, and then inscribe the talisman.

*Incantation:*
Spirits of the Nine Prisons, great deities of Fengdu,
Zhang and Ma, the Four Poisons, subdue and capture demonic spirits.
Golden nets and iron webs enclose and seize perverse essences.
By the edict of the Three Heavenly Emperors, the law is strictly enforced.
The earth gods of the nine provinces and the local deities dispatch their troops.
Wind, fire, thunder, and lightning reduce ghosts to dust.
With a hundred thousand, ten thousand, a thousand legions,
black winds and fire bells resound.
The prison is named Great Fire—none escape to be reborn.
Iron lions and bronze dogs devour your forms.
With the first stroke, Heaven and Earth are inscribed;
with the second, essences are extinguished;
with the third, the Wind Earl is summoned;
with the fourth, the prison is completed.
The divine talisman descends to suppress; myriad ghosts are overthrown.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

After reciting the incantation seven times, the talisman is complete.

*Incantation:*
Spirits of the Nine Prisons of Fengdu,
by the Emperor’s decree, they are dispatched.
Those who dare disobey shall be punished by the soldiers of the Five Peaks.
The Six Ding and Six Jia spirits seize them; the steps of the Dipper and Pivot are merciless.
The edict is entrusted beneath the Pivot Star—no ghost retains its form.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation seven times, spray water seven times upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

**The Divine Talisman of Thunder Duke of Highest Clarity**
The Divine Talisman of Thunder Duke of Highest Clarity is employed to remedy pestilential *qi*, miasmic *qi* from mountains and mists, the five types of *gu* poison, consumptive illnesses, mountain spirits and demonic entities, violent and unrestrained wandering dead, lingering corpses and ancient anomalies, those who drowned, hanged themselves, died in battle, by poison, or in childbirth, as well as wandering spirits of forests and trees that afflict the dwelling’s earth, and deities worshipped by others who have been sent but refuse to depart, or graves that bring forth calamities.
Present a written petition to this court for endorsement, and deliver it to the local earth god before inscribing the talisman on an iron plate.
This talisman consists of five strips, to be buried in the five directions.
Ghosts and spirits will perceive only thunder and fire engulfing the dwelling, leaving them no place to enter, or the afflicted household may dream of their home being consumed by fire.
In households struck by pestilence, the afflicted will see great flames and experience a frenzied state, but upon breaking into a cold sweat, they will immediately recover.
If ancient temples harbor inauspicious omens or forests and trees become instruments of harm to the people, inscribe one talisman and bury it beneath the temple or trees. The temple will crumble on its own, and the forest will wither; otherwise, heavenly fire will consume them.
If water harbors anomalies, inscribe one talisman and cast it into the water. The anomaly will vanish, the ghost will be driven away, and a dragon will arise.
Iron plates must be forged on a *water* day and inscribed on a *fire* day.
The iron plate measures one foot and four inches in length and eight inches in width.
Inscribe it within a purified chamber, stepping the *ding*-Pivot three times. Form the mudra with the left hand by pressing the *fire* day’s palace, using the *chen* position as the seal, recite the incantation, and inscribe the talisman.

*Incantation:*
Thunder Duke of the Capital Heaven, who summons clouds and shakes the winds.
Green thunder with crimson *qi* penetrates the nine palaces.
Crimson thunder with white *qi* ascends to the highest heavens.
White thunder with black *qi* roams the northern Fengdu.
Black thunder with yellow *qi* surges through the Great Ultimate’s primordial axis.
Yellow thunder with blue-green *qi* fills the empty void.
The celestial fire realm blazes with scorching winds.
What spirit does not submit? What ghost does not obey?
Those who oppose me perish; those who follow me are enfeoffed.
Northern clouds, black calendars, the Nine Uglies, and the Purple Youths.
The Earl of Wind and the Master of Rain drive lightning and consume winds.
Where the divine talisman arrives, no perverse ghost remains.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

After reciting the incantation fourteen times, the talisman is complete. Bury it beneath the dwelling’s ground.

*Incantation:*
Great Thunder Duke of the Capital Heaven,
whose thunderclaps transform the empty void.
Three hundred thousand blades and soldiers scatter in the crimson cavern.
Those who dare disobey shall face the stern decree without mercy.
Entrusted beneath the Pivot Star, they become forever pure and serene winds.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation eighty-one times, spray water nine times upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

**The Divine Talisman of Fire Bells of Highest Clarity**

The **Divine Talisman of Fire Bells of Highest Clarity** addresses women who fail to conceive, suffer unstable pregnancies, or miscarry within three to five months; those whose children do not survive past one or two years; and cases where despite extensive prayers and offerings, no remedy proves effective. Such afflictions are no ordinary matter. They may arise from adverse *fengshui* in the household, malign influences from ancestral graves, lingering *fushi* (buried corpses) in the dwelling, inauspicious wells or stoves, ritual transgressions, baleful stellar deities, marital incompatibility in the couple’s destinies, ancestral wrongdoing, past-life neglect of descendants, or offenses against parents by one’s own forebears—or from uncleanliness within the home.

To ensure robust offspring and longevity, strict abstinence is required: on the new and full moons, the waxing and waning quarters, the four seasons and eight solar terms, the *jiazi* and *gengshen* days, during great winds or rains, extreme cold or heat, after excessive eating or drinking, under the stars and moon, before well and stove deities, amid thunder and lightning, when auspicious clouds appear, or during solar and lunar eclipses—all such times demand restraint from conjugal relations. Adherence to these precepts ensures stable conception, perfect features in the child, and extended blessings of fortune and longevity. Failure to comply, even if the firstborn survives, will result in ugliness, poverty, or premature death.

For such cases, submit a written petition to this institute for endorsement. Inscribe the talisman as prescribed, and have the couple wear it. Within a month, auspicious dreams will herald conception, and a noble child will be born. Even after birth, ensure the child wears this talisman to remain free from illness, enjoy lasting fortune and longevity, and be shielded from malevolent spirits and all harm.

If inscribed on iron or wooden plaques of any size, burned with incense, and venerated, the talisman also repels plagues and fire disasters. Write it in cinnabar, pressing the left thumb to the *yin* position while forming the mudra, and recite the incantation as you inscribe it. Those who wear or venerate it will be protected by celestial envoys and spirit officials.

*Incantation:*
Great Fire Bells of the Void,
overseeing life in the highest heavens.
Holding the registers, wielding the ledgers,
Han Gong, who cherishes life.
The Five Emperors shatter souls,
the Three Terraces bestow fates.
The Seven Primes assist the *po*,
the divine origin upholds the lineage.
Corpse-ghosts disperse and converge,
no ghost shall be left destitute.
They receive human destinies,
slaying evil and banishing traces.
By decree of Heaven, eternally granted,
they dwell in the immortal palace.
The Great Spirit of Emptiness,
severing evil and expelling misfortune.
The Nine Heavens’ Controller of Destinies,
ordains the Primordial Ancestor.
Inscribing life’s roots,
enlightening human transcendence.
Cutting off rebellious ghosts,
slashing away evil trails.
The divine talisman shelters,
its true form in purple clouds.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation twenty-one times to complete the inscription.

*Additional Incantation:*
The Great Fire Bells of the Celestial Circuit,
preserving life and extending years.
The Three Corpses all disperse,
the Numinous Treasure guards eternal life.
They reject the destitute and lawless,
seeking only the perfection of the Dao.
Suppressing the Three Yellow Chapters,
the Five Peaks in azure emptiness.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation thirty-six times, spray water once upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

---

**The Divine Talisman of Ding and Jia of Highest Clarity**
The **Divine Talisman of Ding and Jia of Highest Clarity** remedies transgressions against the Grand Year (*Taisui*), earth deities, and *tufu* spirits; or when others’ construction projects cause *feitu* (flying earth) to afflict the dwelling. It also addresses burial offenses against mountain spirits, adverse *fengshui*, frequent calamities, genital sores in women, repeated scalds or burns, chronic illness unresponsive to medicine, baleful stars aligning with one’s fate, causing confusion, procrastination, restless dreams, and household unrest. It counters *cixiongsha* (male-female killing stars), funeral processions, curses from others, persistent illness, mental agitation, and family members afflicted by madness. It dispels *fushi* (lingering corpses), malevolent entities, self-inflicted harm, nocturnal apparitions, lanterns lit or fires set by unseen hands, terrorizing of women and children, and inexplicable loss of wealth.

Submit a written petition to this institute for endorsement, then inscribe this divine talisman. Whether venerated or worn, its efficacy is immediate. For construction projects, inscribe twenty-four copies of this talisman and affix them around the dwelling—no need to suspend work, as benevolent spirits will guard the site, and baleful stars or malevolent forces will dare not harm.

Inscribe the talisman using raw cinnabar, pressing the left thumb to the *wu* position while forming the mudra, and recite the incantation as you write. Its power is infallible.

*Incantation:*
Generals Ding and Jia,
revered deities of Tianpeng.
The Three Terraces lend aid,
the Six Jia and Six Ding.
Nine Uglies lead the vanguard,
mountain spirits are vanquished in the rear.
The spirit of springs and streams aids the crossing,
by the Emperor’s decree they march.
The lands of the Nine Provinces,
mountains, marshes, rivers, and springs.
The Twenty-Eight Constellations,
the Six Spirits at peace.
The Divine Youth executes commands,
the Eight Trigrams honor Qian.
The Vermilion Bird assists,
the Dark Warrior resists.
The Azure Dragon presides,
the White Tiger submits.
Above, they commune with the Golden Gates,
below, they unite with Qian’s origin.
Commanding ghostly soldiers,
their report ascends to Heaven.
The talisman’s master is the Pivot Star,
all myriad evils are crushed and expelled.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation twenty-one times to complete the inscription.

*Additional Incantation:*
Great Generals Ding and Jia,
the sixty deities of Supreme Yang.
The Most High and Lofty Dao,
decrees the Pivot Star Lord.
Seizing mountain and marsh ghosts,
subduing the Yellow Earth spirits.
Any who resist,
Qian’s origin brings harmony and virtue.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation eighty-one times, spray water once upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

**The Divine Talisman of the Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper of Highest Clarity**
The **Divine Talisman of the Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper of Highest Clarity** remedies the lingering consequences of past evil deeds, ancestral curses, and transmitted consumptive illnesses that spread contagiously, defying all medical treatment, until the body withers and the limbs waste away. If one’s fate is not yet exhausted, the affliction may first pass to descendants, perpetuating an unending cycle of suffering.

Thus did the Celestial Emperor take pity, bestowing this sacred talisman. Have it transcribed in seal script and burned to ashes. Take seven willow twigs, each carved with the character for "child," and steep them in ashless wine. Drink three doses daily, and within ten days the worms shall perish, and the body gradually restore itself. Those afflicted with such conditions must submit a written petition to this institute, where their circumstances shall be recorded and presented to the Celestial Emperor. A memorial shall also be dispatched to the sacred mountains and rivers to seek absolution. Only then may this talisman be transcribed, given to the sufferer, and swallowed according to the prescribed method. Additionally, transcribe twenty-one copies of this talisman, affix them to the four corners of the dwelling, and carry one on the person. Auspicious dreams shall soon follow, and the Perfected Ones of the Highest Clarity shall descend with true qi to guard the body. Wearing this talisman ensures protection of life, defense of the person, averts misfortune, and secures great fortune for the household.

This talisman must be transcribed with cinnabar, using the left thumb to press the "zi" position as the mudra while reciting the incantation. The incantation reads:

The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper,
Jade Perfected, divine and numinous.
Greedy Wolf and Great Gate,
preserve life and grant enduring glory.
Salary Star and Literary Curve,
bestow wisdom upon your servant.
Integrity Star and Martial Tune,
guard your servant in peace.
Broken Soldier and Auxiliary Star,
shield your servant’s form.
Ever dwell in fortune,
eternally abide in blessed longevity.
Inscribe in the register of life,
strike from the ledger of death.
Spirit clear, qi refreshed,
penetrating the hidden and obscure.
Command demons, subdue ghosts,
all malevolent forces topple and fall.
Those who cultivate the Dao and refine the true,
may their aspirations be fulfilled.
The Seven Primes extend their protection,
ascending to the Purple Court.
The spirit lords of the five viscera,
each safeguard in tranquility.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation fourteen times to complete the transcription.

Another incantation reads:
Great Sage of the Seven Primes,
supreme deities of the heavens.
Grant eternal longevity,
the Three Corpses flee in disarray.
The mighty divine general, Lifting Ram,
seals the gate of death.
Dhāraṇī scatters flowers,
prolonging the years of life.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite seven times, spray water once upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

**The Divine Talisman of the Three Terraces of Highest Clarity**
The **Divine Talisman of the Three Terraces of Highest Clarity** embodies the constellation of great peace and fortune, governing all affairs. When one’s fate aligns with this stellar configuration, yet their fortune remains obstructed, malignant stars cast their baleful influence, repeatedly inviting official disputes, pestilence, and jaundice to the household. The eldest son often falls ill, women endure difficult childbirth, and ancestral enemies or creditors exact their due in life or wealth, with no means of escape. Submit a written petition to this institute, whereupon this true talisman shall be transcribed on yellow silk and worn upon the head. Immediately, the baleful stars shall withdraw, and vengeful ghosts shall not intrude.

This talisman is the hidden treasure of the heavens, the most true and precious. Using the left thumb to press the "chen" position as the mudra, recite the incantation while transcribing. The incantation reads:

Three Terraces Star Lords,
guard my form.
With celestial cover,
purple qi flows smoothly.
The Nine Primes gather,
severing and subduing with might.
The Great One bends to me,
the *River Chart* and Six Classics.
Highest Perfected Kings,
soaring through the heavens, self-sealed.
Free from sorrow, Origin Prime,
illuminating the essence of the embryo.
Four fierce steeds arrayed,
banners, drums, and golden bells.
Mighty Celestial Armored Soldiers,
the Six Jia and Six Ding.
Roaming the world,
concealing my form.
What disaster dares appear?
What ghost dares glare?
Those who cast baleful eyes shall perish,
those who glare shall fall.
A single talisman,
and Heaven shall not see my form.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation fourteen times to complete the transcription.

Another incantation reads:
The Three Terraces bring me forth,
my life granted longevity.
The Three Terraces nurture me,
the Celestial Emperor protects and sustains.
The Three Terraces guard me,
eternal peace and tranquility.
Decreed to the Mighty Ridge below,
origin, prosperity, great benefit, and virtue.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation forty-nine times, spray water once upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

**The Divine Talisman of the Black Killer of Highest Clarity**
The **Divine Talisman of the Black Killer of Highest Clarity** remedies the mischief of water monsters, river dragons, and sea serpents that stir winds and waves, capsizing boats and demanding sacrifices, thereby harming lives. Submit a written petition to this institute, whereupon an iron plaque, one foot and two inches in length and seven inches in width, shall be inscribed with this talisman in cinnabar and placed to suppress the site of the malevolent activity. The dragon or serpent shall immediately relocate. When the Black Killer Perfected Lord hears of a dragon or serpent violating the talisman, he shall personally descend to subdue it. When crossing rivers or seas, transcribe the talisman on paper and wear it to avoid water calamities and repel aquatic monsters. It also pacifies households and dispels disasters and strange occurrences.

Using the left thumb to press the "hai" position as the mudra, recite the incantation while transcribing, and use cinnabar. The incantation reads:

Black Killer Perfected Lord,
your radiance transforms sun and moon,
your might stabilizes Heaven and Earth.
Wielding talismans to command and record,
sealing the gates of ghosts.
Roaming the world,
capturing and subduing spirits.
Divine soldiers deploy qi,
sweeping away the Five Pestilences.
Left and right officers and soldiers,
the Three and Five Generals.
Thunder Lords and lightning bolts,
charging through clouds.
Swords like rain,
banners and weapons like clouds.
Spitting fangs and exerting strength,
shattering their forms.
The Earth Gods of the Nine Provinces,
the blood-fed soldiers.
The talisman’s decree descends,
the law is obeyed.
Those who defy,
shall be slain without mercy.
Kui and Dragon resplendent,
red clouds and the Purple Court.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation eighteen times to complete the transcription.

Another incantation reads:
Black Killer, mighty divine,
boundlessly aiding the Dharma realm.
Seizing demons, binding evil spirits,
traversing the celestial spheres.
Driving dragons into rivers and seas,
reaching the suffering in hidden realms.
Golden swords sever malevolent forces,
ghosts and demons shall yield.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands.

Recite the incantation twenty-one times, spray water once upon the talisman, and release the mudra.

**The Divine Talisman of the True Forms of the Five Peaks of Highest Clarity**
The **Divine Talisman of the True Forms of the Five Peaks of Highest Clarity** subdues wolves and tigers when entering mountains and tames dragons and serpents when entering water.

Wearing it brings auspiciousness and averts calamities. It prevents damage to houses from insects and ants, strange occurrences when birds fly into dwellings, and the appearance of snakes and vermin. In such cases, submit a petition to this court for registration, then inscribe this talisman on a catalpa wood board, two feet and four inches in length and one foot and two inches in width, using cinnabar. Nail it to the residence, and the strange phenomena will dissolve, insects and ants will depart, and they shall never cause harm again. If worn on the person, it protects the body and safeguards life, repelling all dangers. Those who cultivate the Dao must wear it to avoid demonic obstructions.

To inscribe this talisman, form the mudra by pressing the left thumb against the upper joint of the index finger, recite the incantation, and write. The incantation reads:
The true forms of the Five Peaks,

#### **Seal of the Nine Elders of the Upper Clarity Immortal Capital**
The Seal of the Nine Elders of the Upper Clarity Immortal Capital, when worn into the mountains, subdues wolves, tigers, and spectral beings; when crossing rivers, winds and rains align to aid passage. To treat night terrors in children, fright-wind, and all manner of ailments in adults, burn the seal to ash and administer it with frankincense decoction—efficacy is immediate. It hastens childbirth and expels stillborn fetuses; when worn, it stabilizes pregnancy. For women without children, it brings conception. It resolves curses, redresses grievances, sharpens the mind, and fulfills all uses.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of eight characters in two lines of stacked seal script.

The Seal of Governance and Universal Command serves as a military seal. Its bearer commands all spirits, immortals, officials, territorial deities, city gods, earth temples, and spectral soldiers across the Three Realms, regardless of rank. Worn, it carries the authority of the Celestial Emperor; all ferocious spirits submit. Without this seal, those practicing methods cannot deploy spectral troops. When the seal moves, the troops advance; when it halts, they stop. To move the seal is to move the army. If troops disobey, all—regardless of rank—are executed, as spectral enforcers ensure justice. After execution, a memorial may be submitted to the Celestial Emperor.

Thus, troops follow the seal’s turn, generals obey its commands; violations of orders incur severe penalties.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of six characters in two lines of stacked seal script.

This seal must not be used alongside others. To summon sweet rains, inscribe an iron plaque at a dragon’s abode, seal it with paper, and impress it with this seal. If waters harbor monsters, forests spawn demons, or ancient temples invite disaster, draft a document, affix the seal, and impress it—waterborne creatures will perish, temples collapse, forests wither, or be consumed by celestial fire and lightning.

The seal measures two *cun* and two *fen* in width, perfectly square, eight *fen* thick. Its inscription consists of six characters in two lines of stacked celestial seal script.

Wherever the city god travels, yin officials report, and spectral escorts attend. Assigned assistant soldiers and clerics accompany them through mountains, forests, temples, and across rivers or seas. Day and night, subordinate troops remain at their side. **Method for Directing Qi**

At a place of utmost sincerity, face the sun and burn incense. Look up and pray:

*"[State your rank and name], reverently addressing the Great Sun Emperor: I, [your name], practice the Orthodox Methods of the Highest Clarity’s Celestial Pivot Court to relieve the suffering of all people and direct qi to pacify spirits. Today, I humbly beseech your compassion, that you bestow true qi into my body. May my Mud-Pill Palace, all joints, the five viscera, and six bowels be filled and brimming with its vastness. In treating all living beings, may there be no failure."*

Conclude with focused devotion. Strike the Heavenly Drum seven times, open your eyes toward the sun, and press the third joint of each middle finger with your thumbs. Draw in a breath of qi from the sun and swallow it. Recite the incantation seven times, then swallow a second breath. Press your right hand again, recite the incantation seven times, and take in a third breath. Cross both hands before your mouth, recite the incantation seven times, then draw in true qi and blow it onto the two mudras. Repeat this cycle three times in full.

The incantation reads:
*"Wind-pain departs with the wind,
qi-pain vanishes with the qi."*

For those afflicted, have them sit in the southeast, facing northwest. The practitioner stands in the northwest, facing southeast, seated opposite. Instruct the patient to press firmly on the painful area without releasing. First, have them cough once, then draw in a breath of qi—do not swallow it yet. Assume the mudra as before, recite the incantation seven times, then have them cough again, swallow the qi, and recite the incantation once more. For mild cases, three to five repetitions suffice; for severe cases, five to seven. Efficacy is certain.

---

**Method for Enchanting Water**

Purify the mind and focus the intent. Press the center of each palm with the middle fingers and invoke the twenty-eight constellations of the five directions:

*"Reverently summon the true form of the star essence of Horn and Neck in the East, wielding swords and talismans to guard my body.
Reverently summon the true form of the star essence of Well and Ghost in the South, wielding swords and talismans to guard my body.
Reverently summon the true form of the star essence of Straddler and Harvester in the West, wielding swords and talismans to guard my body.
Reverently summon the true form of the star essence of Dipper and Ox in the North, wielding swords and talismans to guard my body.
Reverently summon the true form of the Yellow Essence of the Seven Stars of the Center, wielding swords and talismans to guard my body.
May the true qi of the five directions enter this water."*

This is no ordinary water—it is the natural water of the Highest Clarity’s Boundless Dao, capable of dispelling illness and rescuing from suffering. Wherever a drop of this water falls, all becomes pure. If a true spirit touches it, their divine power expands. If a demonic entity touches it, their body burns as if consumed by fire. This water is formed from the true qi bestowed by the Perfected of the Upper Heavens. What evil would not submit? What ghost would dare appear? Those who oppose me shall die; those who turn away shall perish. Where this divine water arrives, the myriad ghosts hide in submission.

The incantation reads:
*"Kui-Yuan, Qian-Yuan, Li-Zhen, You-Zhen.
Supreme Void, I invoke your decree,
Gate of Kunlun’s Heavenly Portal.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Highest Clarity’s statutes and commands."*

Recite it twenty-one times. Sprinkle this water to cleanse all defilements; swallow talismans with it, and none will fail to respond. During epidemics, sprinkle it inside and outside dwellings. For the sick, boil it into decoctions or powders—its efficacy is undeniable, and there is no purpose for which it cannot be used.

---

**Method for Extracting Consumptive Worms**

For those suffering from corpse-transmitted illness within one hundred and twenty days, first earnestly invite a Zhengyi Daoist to perform a three-day jiao ritual. Prepare three talismans and administer them to the patient as follows.

On the fourth day, prepare a cauldron with at least five *jin* of heated oil and a bolt of white silk to bind the patient to a pillar. Use three left-spun silk threads, each four *chi* and four *cun* long. Affix one talisman to each thread on a peachwood stick, and have the patient swallow them with ginseng decoction. One thread is held steady as the talisman draws the thread into the abdomen. Use a ruler to pry open the patient’s mouth, swiftly pull out the talisman, and the worm will be upon it. Repeat this three times to extract three worms, which will shriek as they fall into the oil and fry. Only then is the patient safe. If only one or two worms are extracted, death is certain.

**First Talisman**
Use a half-*cun* square of silk, inscribed in cinnabar. Form the mudra with the left hand on the *wu* position, recite the incantation, and seal it in a wax pill. Administer at the *chou* hour of the first day with frankincense decoction. Recite the incantation three times to complete the inscription.

The incantation reads:
*"Divine spirits of the Three Lights of Heaven,
grant me the mandate of life.
By this decree, I sever you—
the calamity arrives, the method is executed."*

**Second Talisman**
Use a half-*cun* square of silk, inscribed in cinnabar. Form the mudra with the left hand on the *shen* position, recite the incantation, and seal it in a wax pill. Administer at the *wu* hour of the second day with frankincense decoction. Recite the incantation three times to complete the inscription.

The incantation reads:
*"Originally, you harmed me—
now I expel and unite with you.
Like all flying heavens,
you wander as corpse-drinking ghosts."*

**Third Talisman**
Use a half-*cun* square of silk, inscribed in cinnabar. Form the mudra with the left hand on the *hai* position, recite the incantation, and seal it in a wax pill. Administer at the *hai* hour of the third day with frankincense decoction. Recite the incantation three times to complete the inscription.

The incantation reads:
*"Great Lord of the Supreme Dao,
receive my protection of this form.
Auspicious blessings descend with the Heavenly Talisman,
the Great One unites with the Primordial Perfected."*

---

**Method for Treating Illness**

The illness may be treated after seven days of onset. When it flares, press the center of each palm with the middle fingers while observing the patient. Recite the incantation seven times, have the patient cough once, and draw in a breath of qi toward the wall, reciting the incantation three times over it. Instruct the patient to avoid the five pungent foods and toxic substances for seven days.

The incantation reads:

Talisman for Securing the Household
Talisman for Dispersing Swelling and Toxins"*
